Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy drawing insights from research and telling stories with data?

 

Are you motivated by the opportunity to represent an incredibly diverse and vibrant destination?

 

Do you love where you live, work and play?

 

If so, Destination Vancouver's Research Analyst role could be the right match for you.

 

As one of Destination Vancouver’s Research Analysts, you will play a key role in gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data to inform strategic decisions and initiatives designed to inform business planning, enhance visitor experiences, and increase Vancouver’s destination competitiveness. 

 

Reporting to the Manager, Research & Business Insights and working closely with the Research team, the Research Analyst will be responsible for conducting comprehensive research, data analysis, generating insights, and producing reports that contribute to the development and implementation of effective destination development and promotion strategies led by the Destination Vancouver team, and in collaboration with industry partners.

 

In collaboration with internal business units, the Research Analyst will support timely and effective business decision-making for the ongoing development and evolution of the organization, industry partners and the destination.

 

This role is ideal for an individual who is motivated by the latest trends and research, with an aptitude to draw insights from and tell stories with research and data. Strong analytical skills complement advanced organizational skills and resourcefulness.

 

Key Accountabilities:

 

Research & Data Analysis
Insightful Reporting
Strategic Support
Effective Collaboration & Communication




Specific Responsibilities:

 

Collect and monitor economic, consumer, market and industry trends and developments to inform internal business planning and strategies.

Conduct primary and secondary research to understand visitor behaviours, motivators, and emerging trends.

Analyze data to identify key insights, trends, and patterns that inform decision-making and business planning processes.

Conduct research to inform destination development initiatives, which may include advocacy, planning and policy development, capacity building, sustainability and environmental stewardship, and product and experience development.

 Assist with data modelling, forecasting and economic impact analysis.

 Examine data to test hypotheses and make recommendations.

Work with Destination Vancouver members and stakeholders to collect, monitor and analyze real-time data to monitor tourism industry and market performance.

Assist in identifying opportunities and gaps in data to help prioritize internal research and data analytics projects.

Data cleaning, extraction, transformation and loading.

Collaborate with internal teams to provide data insights and recommendations that support the development and execution of destination development and destination promotion initiatives.

Distill and communicate key insights across all levels of the organization in verbal, written and visual formats.

Design and deploy industry survey programs to collect input from members, partners and stakeholders, analysis and reporting of results.

Support research partnerships with external stakeholders and collaborate with third-party vendors to execute.

Field and fulfill information requests from Destination Vancouver members, internal Team Members as well as other stakeholders including Destination Marketing Organizations, education institutions, students, government and consultants.

Stay current with industry developments, research methodologies and analytical tools to continuously improve research processes and ensure Destination Vancouver remains at the forefront of tourism research and analysis.

Provide support for other research and data analytics initiatives as required.

 

Who are we?

 

Destination Vancouver is one of the world's most dynamic destination management organizations, delivering on a mandate of destination development and promotion that positions Vancouver as a must visit global destination.

 

Our purpose is to transform our communities and our visitors through the power of travel. This underpins everything we do and how we communicate with potential clients, engage with partners, and support our 600+ members.

 

Destination Vancouver has a fabulous product and a powerful brand. Our success is measured through the triple bottom line approach of equal emphasis on people, planet and prosperity. And as a private, not-for-profit business association, our continued relevancy is based on supporting our industry, responsibly and sustainably managing the destination, and building a competitive global destination brand.

 

What do we offer?

 

This role is based in Destination Vancouver's corporate offices with sweeping views of the North Shore mountains and proximity to transit and downtown amenities.

 

Expected starting salary range: $55,000 to $62,000.

 

We are proud to offer a competitive Total Rewards package including:







3 weeks’ vacation (15 days)
Additional paid Wellness days
Annual incentive/recognition program
Extended health care benefits
Health spending account and Personal (Wellness) spending account
Group RRSP matching program
Transit reimbursement
Team Member Referral program
Training and development opportunities
Flexible work environment.
Tourism industry perks




Destination Vancouver believes in and provides a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment.




What are we looking for?

 

Relevant experience in a similar business insights/research & analytics role.
Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science and/or related field or experience.
Understanding of market research principles, statistics, quantitative and qualitative research best practices, standards and applications.
Demonstrated experience in developing reports, dashboards and presentations as well as gathering, synthesizing, evaluating and interpreting information from diverse sources.
Experience in computer applications and Microsoft Office, database applications, data management solutions, statistical software and AI tools in addition to data visualization and dashboarding tools.
Experience with digital analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, social media tools and applications) is an asset.
Strong research and analytical skills, attention to detail, precision and accuracy.
Ability to draw insights from and tell stories with data and research to a non-technical business-oriented audience.
Project management experience (supplier and/or client side) is an asset.
A collaborative team player who works effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills, verbal and written.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple projects/exceptional time management skills.
Demonstrates a high level of maturity, diplomacy and professionalism at all times. Proven ability to maintain discretion and management of confidential information.
Ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders.
Passionate about Vancouver as an international travel destination.

 

If this sounds like you because you have the background, ambition and are focused on building relationships and achieving results, we invite you to apply for this exciting position. Please send your resume and cover letter to: careers@destinationvancouver.com

 

For more information, please visit http://destinationvancouver.com

 Examine data to test hypotheses and make recommendations.

Work with Destination Vancouver members and stakeholders to collect, monitor and analyze real-time data to monitor tourism industry and market performance.

Assist in identifying opportunities and gaps in data to help prioritize internal research and data analytics projects.

Data cleaning, extraction, transformation and loading.

Collaborate with internal teams to provide data insights and recommendations that support the development and execution of destination development and destination promotion initiatives.

Distill and communicate key insights across all levels of the organization in verbal, written and visual formats.

Design and deploy industry survey programs to collect input from members, partners and stakeholders, analysis and reporting of results.

Support research partnerships with external stakeholders and collaborate with third-party vendors to execute.

Field and fulfill information requests from Destination Vancouver members, internal Team Members as well as other stakeholders including Destination Marketing Organizations, education institutions, students, government and consultants.

Stay current with industry developments, research methodologies and analytical tools to continuously improve research processes and ensure Destination Vancouver remains at the forefront of tourism research and analysis.

Provide support for other research and data analytics initiatives as required.

 

Who are we?

 

Destination Vancouver is one of the world's most dynamic destination management organizations, delivering on a mandate of destination development and promotion that positions Vancouver as a must visit global destination.

 

Our purpose is to transform our communities and our visitors through the power of travel. This underpins everything we do and how we communicate with potential clients, engage with partners, and support our 600+ members.

 

Destination Vancouver has a fabulous product and a powerful brand. Our success is measured through the triple bottom line approach of equal emphasis on people, planet and prosperity. And as a private, not-for-profit business association, our continued relevancy is based on supporting our industry, responsibly and sustainably managing the destination, and building a competitive global destination brand.

 

What do we offer?

 

This role is based in Destination Vancouver's corporate offices with sweeping views of the North Shore mountains and proximity to transit and downtown amenities.

 

Expected starting salary range: $55,000 to $62,000.

 

We are proud to offer a competitive Total Rewards package including:



  • 3 weeks’ vacation (15 days)
  • Additional paid Wellness days
  • Annual incentive/recognition program
  • Extended health care benefits
  • Health spending account and Personal (Wellness) spending account
  • Group RRSP matching program
  • Transit reimbursement
  • Team Member Referral program
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Flexible work environment.
  • Tourism industry perks


Destination Vancouver believes in and provides a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment.


What are we looking for?

 

  • Relevant experience in a similar business insights/research & analytics role.
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science and/or related field or experience.
  • Understanding of market research principles, statistics, quantitative and qualitative research best practices, standards and applications.
  • Demonstrated experience in developing reports, dashboards and presentations as well as gathering, synthesizing, evaluating and interpreting information from diverse sources.
  • Experience in computer applications and Microsoft Office, database applications, data management solutions, statistical software and AI tools in addition to data visualization and dashboarding tools.
  • Experience with digital analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, social media tools and applications) is an asset.
  • Strong research and analytical skills, attention to detail, precision and accuracy.
  • Ability to draw insights from and tell stories with data and research to a non-technical business-oriented audience.
  • Project management experience (supplier and/or client side) is an asset.
  • A collaborative team player who works effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills, verbal and written.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple projects/exceptional time management skills.
  • Demonstrates a high level of maturity, diplomacy and professionalism at all times. Proven ability to maintain discretion and management of confidential information.
  • Ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders.
  • Passionate about Vancouver as an international travel destination.

 

If this sounds like you because you have the background, ambition and are focused on building relationships and achieving results, we invite you to apply for this exciting position. Please send your resume and cover letter to: careers@destinationvancouver.com

 

For more information, please visit http://destinationvancouver.com

Title: Raw Materials Data Analyst - Temporary
Description:
Department: Raw Materials

Reports to: Senior Data Analyst, Raw Materials

Location: North Vancouver, BC




Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:




As a Raw Materials Data Analyst - Temporary, you will be providing the Raw Materials (RM) team with the clear and actionable data they need to make informed decisions.  You will spot the trends in the data that drive sourcing strategies. This is an opportunity to grow with the new Raw Materials Sourcing team.  You will be primarily focused on supporting the RM Sourcing, RM Development, Supply Planning, and Color Operations teams.

 

This is a one-year temporary contract. This role is based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.




Meet Your Future Team:




The Raw Materials Sourcing team is part of the Raw Materials organization and includes the Raw Materials Supply Planning team.  The team partners closely with finished goods Sourcing and Supply Planning, and our Hong-Kong Office teams to grow our business and create a world class supply chain.




Other teams you will work closely with include Raw Materials Development, Product Development, Design, Quality, Compliance, Merchandising, Merchandise Planning, Global Planning, Product Operations, to name a few.  Your priority is to ensure that our Tier 2 supply chain can deliver on all seasonal commercialization requirements, while anticipating the future needs of the business.




If you were the Raw Materials Data Analyst - Temporary now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Fielding, analyzing and reporting data on seasonal materials forecast, capacity, inventory and delivery
Supporting tooling and reporting creation and maintenance requirements for Raw Materials Sourcing and Supply Planning GTM operations
Collaborating on systems and tooling special projects, representing Raw Materials in line with priorities and guidance from the Senior Data Analyst, Raw Materials; and Director, Raw Materials Sourcing
Developing use of data and KPIs to drive cohesive visibility and understanding of T2 Supply Planning and Sourcing performance and management
Collaborating with Supply Chain partners, including Hong-Kong Office to streamline communication and exchange of information
Working with IT teams on data integration projects to improve reporting and empower T2 suppliers to self input and report
Working to automate manual processes to improve accuracy and efficiency
Upholding Fair Labor Association’s Workplace Code of Conduct and Principles of Fair Labor and Responsible Sourcing throughout the Arc’teryx supply chain
Working closely with the Amer Sports Global Sourcing Vendor Sustainability team on quarterly business reviews and training/capacity building (at least annually)
Adhering to negotiated lead times and balanced annual capacities to expedite responsible purchasing practices as outlined in the Responsible Sourcing Policy




Here’s what you could be working on in the future:
Employing AI to generate real time intelligence and provide actionable recommendations
Exploring opportunities in blockchain to enable traceability and authenticity




Are you our next Raw Materials Data Analyst - Temporary?
You have 2+ years of product commercialization or supply chain experience
You have robust experience with data analytics, and you can leverage data to inform effective decision making within teams
You have an appetite for crunching data and understand the advantage it represents to an organization
You understand the downstream impact of the decisions that are made in Raw Materials Sourcing
You are a wizard with Microsoft Excel and Power Query (Language M), have working familiarity with PLM and ERP systems, and are a quick learner of new platforms
You have working proficiency with Power BI or other visualization tools; SQL and DAX
You have general understanding of raw materials supply chains and supply chain management
You have strong people leadership and mentoring experience
You inspire creative thinking and continuous improvement
You are comfortable with a high growth environment and address ambiguity with positivity.
You align your team around common objectives and promote accountability
You are inquisitive and ask questions – you enable curiosity and an empowered team
You understand the value of data to drive decision making and seek the latest in data technology
You have excellent communication skills, ability to relate to all levels of stakeholders
You can think strategically and balance the needs of multiple cross functional teams
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You effectively balance autonomy and collaboration
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it.
Foreign language skills are a plus







Equal Opportunity




Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 




Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  




All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.




Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 




Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$70,000 - CAD$97,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. The upper end of the range is typically reserved for candidates with demonstrated expertise that is above job requirements or who bring exceptional directly transferable experience.
Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

Title: Data Engineer - Remote - Canada
Description:
About FullStack

FullStack is the most transparent IT talent network, connecting highly skilled individuals with top global companies and Silicon Valley startups for remote, on-demand projects. We focus on building a trusted, high-performance network where talent can thrive in a positive, respectful, and supportive environment. By prioritizing transparency, fair opportunities, and professional growth, we empower our engineers to deliver their best work while collaborating with innovative teams worldwide.

We’re Most Proud Of


Offering life-changing opportunities for talented software professionals across the Americas.
Enhancing highly-skilled software development teams of hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
Our 4.2-star rating on GlassDoor.
Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.


The Opportunity

Join our talent network and connect with U.S. clients for flexible, project-based development work as a Data Engineer.


You will integrate directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.


What We're Looking For


5+ years of professional experience in Data Engineering.
Advanced English is required.
Successful completion of a four-year college degree is required.
Proven track record of designing, developing, and maintaining robust data pipelines using tools like Databricks.
Extensive experience working in cloud-based data environments such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Strong command of SQL and Python for data processing, transformation, and performance tuning.
Demonstrated experience building scalable data lakes, warehouses, and analytics platforms for BI and ML use cases.
Ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
Practical knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows, including testing, version control, and automated deployments.
Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of applications.
Forensic attention to detail.
A positive mindset and a can-do attitude.
Experience working on Agile / Scrum teams.
Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.
Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.


What We Offer


Competitive pay.
100% remote work.
The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
Continuing education opportunities
Opportunity to grow and expand your career


Our talent network is committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and accessible environment where IT professionals can find opportunities that match their skills. We welcome individuals of all races, religions, genders, sexual orientations, national origins, abilities, and experiences. Our focus is on connecting talent with projects based on qualifications, ensuring a fair and transparent process that values diverse perspectives and global collaboration.

Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice.

Title: Senior Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future.

Aperçu de l’entreprise

Chez Motorola Solutions, nous pensons que tout commence par nos employés. Nous sommes une communauté mondiale soudée, unie par la volonté incessante de contribuer à la sécurité des personnes partout dans le monde. Nos technologies de communication, de sécurité vidéo et de centre de commandement essentielles soutiennent les agences de sécurité publique et les entreprises, permettant une coordination essentielle pour des communautés, des écoles, des hôpitaux et des entreprises plus sécuritaires. Connectez-vous à une carrière qui compte et aidez-nous à bâtir un avenir plus sûr.

Department Overview

Motorola Solutions ﬁxed and mobile video, access control and software solutions, led by our Avigilon Alta, Avigilon Unity, Pelco & Envysion portfolios help you ﬁnd, analyze and share information so you can respond to events with speed and decisiveness to keep your people and property safe. Whether you are looking to deploy a new video security or access control solution, equip your team with body-worn cameras, or leverage analytics through purpose-built applications, we have solutions to meet your needs.

Job Description

Position Overview

This role involves leveraging data analytics to drive financial reporting, process automation, and strategic decision-making. A successful candidate will bridge technical data expertise with financial acumen, ensuring accurate reporting, system optimization, and proactive problem-solving within the finance function. The candidate will own data workflows from collection to visualization, demonstrating technical knowledge and strategic problem-solving capabilities.

Key Responsibilities


Oversee the preparation and delivery of financial reports for monthly/quarterly cycles, ensuring alignment with regulatory and organizational standards
Design, maintain, and optimize Power BI and Tableau dashboards for real-time financial performance tracking and stakeholder communication
Automate repetitive financial workflows (e.g., data collection, report generation) using Python, SQL, or low-code platforms like Power Automate
Act as the AI subject matter expert for the company by advising on ways to implement throughout the business
Proactively identify data discrepancies, system inefficiencies, or reporting gaps and implement corrective measures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate financial data into actionable business insights
Develop predictive models to forecast financial trends and assess risk scenarios


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years’ experience in financial data analysis
Technical qualifications:
Expert-level Power BI/Power Query development
Production-grade Python/SQL scripting (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Data modeling and warehouse architecture principles
Demonstrated ability to:
Simplify complex financial data for non-technical audiences
Troubleshoot system errors and implement technical solutions independently
Manage multiple priorities in deadline-driven environment
Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques for automation and process improvement
Background in developing self-service reporting tools for business teams


Differentiating Skills


Experience implementing machine learning workflows (predictive modeling, pattern recognition)
Knowledge of cloud analytics platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience incorporating AI strategies in reporting and business processes
Background in developing API integrations or data governance frameworks


Target Base Salary Range: $85,000 - $105,000 CAD

Consistent with Motorola Solutions values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. Pay within this range varies and depends on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The actual offer will be based on the individual candidate.

Basic Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree with 3+ years’ experience in financial data analysis


Travel Requirements

Under 10%

Relocation Provided

None

Position Type

Experienced

Referral Payment Plan

Yes

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic.

We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please complete this Reasonable Accommodations Form so we can assist you.

Motorola Solutions adopte, favorise et promeut les principes de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous encourageons et accueillons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelles que soient leur race, origines ethnique, religion ou croyance, orientation sexuelle, identité et expression sexuelle, statut d’anciens combattants ou tout autre statut protégé par la Loi.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture axée sur les personnes et les communautés, encourageant ainsi chaque Motorolan d’être la version la plus authentique de lui-même dans ses responsabilités afin de tenir la promesse d’un monde plus sécuritaire.

Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre communauté mais croyez que vous ne possédez pas toutes les exigences requises pour le poste convoité, nous aimerions tout de même connaître les raisons pour lesquelles vous pensez être un excellent candidat pour notre équipe.

Nous offrons également des mesures d’adaptation pendant toutes les étapes du processus d’embauche afin de favoriser l’inclusion des personnes vivant avec un handicap physique et/ou mental. Pour demander un aménagement, veuillez remplir ce formulaire d'aménagement raisonnable afin que nous puissions vous aider.

    We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please complete this Reasonable Accommodations Form so we can assist you.

    Motorola Solutions adopte, favorise et promeut les principes de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous encourageons et accueillons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelles que soient leur race, origines ethnique, religion ou croyance, orientation sexuelle, identité et expression sexuelle, statut d’anciens combattants ou tout autre statut protégé par la Loi.

    Nous sommes fiers de notre culture axée sur les personnes et les communautés, encourageant ainsi chaque Motorolan d’être la version la plus authentique de lui-même dans ses responsabilités afin de tenir la promesse d’un monde plus sécuritaire.

    Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre communauté mais croyez que vous ne possédez pas toutes les exigences requises pour le poste convoité, nous aimerions tout de même connaître les raisons pour lesquelles vous pensez être un excellent candidat pour notre équipe.

    Nous offrons également des mesures d’adaptation pendant toutes les étapes du processus d’embauche afin de favoriser l’inclusion des personnes vivant avec un handicap physique et/ou mental. Pour demander un aménagement, veuillez remplir ce formulaire d'aménagement raisonnable afin que nous puissions vous aider.

Title: Demographic Analyst
Description:
About Univerus

Univerus is a global software company that unites industry-leading solutions on a single, intuitive platform. Headquartered in Port Moody, British Columbia, we serve over 3,500 clients across eight countries. Our mission is to simplify complex operations by providing scalable, user-friendly technology that empowers organizations in local government, utilities, education, manufacturing, recruitment, sport and recreation, and more.

At Univerus, we believe in the power of connection – between people, technology, and communities. Our team is passionate about delivering innovative solutions that help our customers achieve meaningful outcomes while building a workplace where employees can grow, thrive, and make an impact.

Learn more at univerus.com.

ABOUT BARAGAR SYSTEMS (a Univerus Company)

Baragar Systems’ corporate philosophy is to stay ahead of the curve with respect to the education space. With over 40 years of innovation and commitment to excellence, Baragar is the industry leader in School District planning software and services.

School district planning is complex and traditionally is a very reactive process. Baragar Systems’ mission is to empower clients to move towards proactive planning that addresses the needs of all stakeholders, and facilitates data-driven, confidence-inspiring processes.

At Baragar, innovation is the way we do business. It starts with the way we perform internal processes, development, and data production. We take the lessons that we’ve learned and apply them to the solutions we develop for our clients, both on the business and the education sides.

Learn more at baragar.com.

Role Overview

The Demographic Analyst supports both internal tool development and client-facing services, with a strong focus on data accuracy, projections, and improving analytical methodologies. This role contributes to the ongoing enhancement of Baragar’s software solutions by developing population and enrolment projections, refining workflows, and providing responsive client support.

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIP


Reports to the Data Analytics Manager
Coordinates with all other members of the Analytics Team
Close working relationship with the Data Warehouse Team and GIS Team for the maintenance and production of data for Baragar software updates, the Research and Development Team for updates to internal and external tools, and the Customer Support Team for client support
Serves as the primary contact for:
Demographic Dynamics (DD) software support
Reviewing projection assumptions with clients
Investigation and resolution of client issues related to DD

Key Responsibilities


Analyze demographic and enrolment data
Develop and refine population and enrolment projections
Test and troubleshoot DD software
Assist with internal tool development and testing
Communicate with clients through written and verbal channels
Create and manage Jira entries and project documentation
Conduct research on methodology improvements and process innovation
Collaborate cross-functionally to support data integrity and software enhancements Support other internal teams as required


KEY MEASUREMENTS

Productivity & Delivery


Timely completion of assigned tasks
Ability to work independently and manage workload effectively


Quality & Accuracy


High attention to detail in data analysis and projections
Accuracy in demographic reporting and assumptions


Collaboration & Communication


Active contribution to team goals and projects
Clear and professional communication with clients and internal teams


Innovation & Problem Solving


Proactive identification and resolution of issues
Contribution to improving methodologies, tools, and workflows


Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Efficiency with Windows OS, file management, and Microsoft Office suite
Strong analytical thinking and data interpretation
Proficient verbal and written communication
Comfortable making decisions with incomplete data
High attention to detail and quality control
Adaptability and openness to changing priorities
Self-driven with a collaborative mindset
Client-focused and solutions-oriented


Required

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field (e.g., Demography, Statistics, Geography, Data Science)
Minimum 1-2 years’ experience working in a related professional work environment


Highly Valued Assets


GIS Certificate or related experience
Strong MS Excel skills, including VBA
Experience with:
Data transformation tools (e.g., Alteryx)
Client training (in-person or virtual)
Technical writing or documentation
Product specification and planning
Educational administration or planning
Programming, AI, or Machine Learning
Background in statistical methods or demographic projections
Experience leading small projects or teams

What We Offer


Health and Dental
EFAP
RRSP Matching
Paid Time Off
Flexible Work Environment
Education Reimbursement Program
Show more

Title: Senior Operations Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Your opportunity

By joining the Kardium team, you can help make a difference in the lives of millions around the world. We have developed a ground-breaking medical device for the minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment of the most common heart rhythm disorder, atrial fibrillation. Atrial fibrillation can cause stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.

Kardium has a fantastic technical team that has developed a product with strong, unique and customer-valued differentiators versus other solutions on the market: The Globe® Pulsed Field System. We have built connections with key opinion leaders who are already using the Globe System and are helping to tell our story.

As an Operational Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-impact dashboards, metrics and reporting across various operational teams. You will play a critical role in enabling real-time operational visibility and data-informed decision-making, supporting both daily execution and strategic planning initiatives. The analyst will work cross-functionally with operations, purchasing, and quality teams, with a strong focus on data quality and continuity during our transition to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system.

Please note, this opportunity is a hybrid work arrangement, located in Burnaby, BC.

Meaningful work you will be part of

 

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Develop and maintain critical operational metrics and key process indicators (KPIs) to support manufacturing, planning, and quality functions
Create and manage visual dashboards to provide real time insight into operational performance using tools such as Power BI and Excel
Provide analytical support for continuous improvement initiatives and projects to identify and prioritize optimization opportunities for cost reduction and performance improvements.
Query and extract relevant data from ERP and other data sources using SQL or other relevant tools.
Partner with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and alignment with operational goals
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop scalable reporting frameworks and templates to support future growth.
Advise on data architecture and structure as systems evolve and new systems introduced, ensuring the right data is collected and accessible.
Lead initiatives to improve data quality and governance, identifying gaps and implementing data validation processes.
Train and support end-users in interpreting dashboard data and utilizing insights for decision-making.
Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations and company policies.


What you bring to the team

Our Kardium team is smart, creative, and passionate about developing cutting-edge medical devices to help improve people’s lives. We work in a collaborative environment based on trust and respect. We understand that only by working together can we solve what was thought unsolvable.

You are suited to our approach and possess these attributes:


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years experience in data analytics or reporting in a manufacturing or supply chain environment.
Advanced skills in Power BI, SQL and Excel.
Highly analytic and data driven with the ability to organize data and derive conclusions
Demonstrated experience building and maintaining dashboards and reporting systems used by cross-functional teams.
Strong understanding of operational process (manufacturing, supply chain) as well as key operations metrics (e.g., OEE, throughput, inventory turns, supplier performance).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience working with ERP systems (Microsoft D365 or equivalent is a strong asset).
Knowledge and experience working in the regulated manufacturing industry is an asset.


Compensation

Kardium has listed the total cash compensation range that we expect to pay applicants for this role, as of the time of this posting. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, and business or organizational needs.


$90,000 – 120,000 (CAD Annually)


Why work at Kardium

A meaningful career working with a truly innovative technology and an ambitious team, combined with:


Knowing every day that you are making a difference in people’s lives by helping treat a condition that affects millions worldwide.
A great working environment with opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge.
An opportunity to extend your knowledge by interacting with other team members in a multi-disciplinary environment that includes electrical and mechanical engineers, biologists, and specialists in human factors, and clinical and regulatory affairs.
An engaged leadership team who believes in mentoring and growing employees’ careers.
Supportive and fun colleagues with plenty of social events to encourage people connections.
And our employees think we are great too – check out Glassdoor to learn more!


Your Benefits & Well-being

Support for you (and your dependents) overall well-being.

Life at Kardium

What makes us a great place to work?


Our Purpose
Our People
Our Culture


At Kardium, we embrace diversity of background, experience, and perspective and we’re committed to inclusion and equity at every level. We encourge applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of all communities.

We collaborate with Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), as volunteer-led groups who share a common dimension of diversity and come together to provide support, education, and other opportunities across Kardium. Examples of our ERGs include Women ERG, Pride ERG, Race Ethnicity & Cultural Heritage (REACH) ERG, Truth & Reconciliation ERG, Persian Community ERG, Chinese ERG, Barangay Kardium (Filipino) ERG, and Irish ERG.

As part of your application, we encourage you to note if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). There will be an optional section in the application form where you can provide this information to the recruitment team.

And our employees think we are great too – check out Glassdoor to learn more!
Show more

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
About the job




We are a data-driven company with a collegial atmosphere looking for performance-driven team members who can do great work for application in the algorithmic trading industry.




Our ideal candidate is a recent (or soon-to-be) PhD graduate, with experience in an academic or post-doc research workplace, looking to apply their quantitative skills to the real world. Our approach is to train successful candidates about our industry, markets, and products, as such we are looking for people seeking their initial foray in the financial industry.




About You:




You are motivated by intellectual challenges, curiosity, and solving problems. You are performance and results driven. You continuously seek to understand new and better approaches to analyze and interpret ‘dirty’ data to improve investment results. You enjoy coding. You love to see your work put into practice.




Please note this is an on-site position in our Vancouver downtown office. For individuals currently living outside of Vancouver, we offer relocation assistance.




What You’ll Do:

Drive projects to completion that will contribute to an existing trading strategy
Write code to automate every aspect of the trading system
Code in Python and use relational time-series databases (kdb+)
Analyze ‘dirty’ data sets to identify possible investment signals
Develop predictive quantities to improve existing trading strategy
Take charge of your own projects, while collaborating with your colleagues and with the portfolio manager




What You Bring:

Mandatory: Ph.D. in mathematics, physics or related fields in quantitative disciplines with a Masters in the hard sciences (including if you will be graduating with a Ph.D. within the next 12 months).
Highly analytical, keen attention to detail.
Innate curiosity and an exceptional critical thinker who is result-oriented.
Ability to implement your ideas in code
Programming experience in Python
Demonstrated expertise in statistics and mathematical modelling.
Strong communications skills (both verbal and written).
Thrive in a performance-based environment.
Require excellence of yourself and in the work you produce.




Nice to Have:

Experience participating in national or international math, physics or computer science competitions is strongly preferred
Experience with C++, R, kdb+ and working in Unix environment.
Legally entitled to work in Canada (however for exceptional candidates we can provide immigration assistance)




Compensation & Benefits:

From $160,000/year plus bonus based on performance
Extended healthcare with usual features including dental, vision and $1,000/year flex component for physio and other such items
RRSP matching on a dollar-for-dollar basis

Show more

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Python & SQL Developer with a solid background in VBA scripting and a strong grasp of accounting and finance principles, particularly in 14A regulatory reporting. This role involves designing, developing, and maintaining data-driven solutions to streamline financial reporting and automation processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and optimize Python scripts and SQL queries to support data extraction, transformation, and reporting tasks.
Automate manual workflows using VBA macros, VBScript, and other scripting tools across Microsoft Office applications.
Support and enhance 14A regulatory reporting processes to ensure data accuracy, compliance, and timely delivery.
Work closely with finance and accounting teams to gather requirements and deliver efficient, reliable solutions.
Debug, troubleshoot, and improve existing code, reports, and data processes.
Create and maintain clear documentation for developed solutions, processes, and best practices.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

Proficient in Python, especially for data processing and automation using Pandas and data frames.
Advanced SQL skills including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and performance tuning.
Strong experience with VBA macros, VBA coding, and VBScript for Excel and other Office applications.
Solid understanding of accounting and finance concepts, with specific experience in 14A regulatory reporting.
Proven experience in scripting and automation within a financial environment.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Show more

Title: Strategic Insights Analyst
Description:
About Vancity

Vancity is a member-owned credit union built on the principles of inclusion and social justice. A relentless commitment to their values has helped them challenge the status quo and break down barriers since day one in 1946. They have bold commitments to make Vancity net-zero by 2040 across all mortgages and loans and are pursuing strategies on Indigenous banking and to improve the financial resilience of their members.




Vancity is the largest private sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and has been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada. If you’re interested in joining their team of 2,700 diverse individuals and accessing competitive rewards and benefits, all while knowing you are part of a greater movement, then apply today!




About the workplace

The Vancity Analytics Centre of Excellence (ACE) is a force for change. Our mandate is simple - we leverage our data with actionable insights that help our leaders make stronger decisions. We use a deeply human approach - telling stories in the language of our stakeholders with a proactive and predictive lens. We don’t rely on complex charts; we focus on the ‘so what’ of every question and insight to deliver value. We work collaboratively with our colleagues to serve our members and our business.




This is a permanent, full-time role that will enjoy hybrid working arrangements which can be fulfilled primarily from the Vancity head office location and your Lower Mainland based home office. Periodically, you’ll be required to attend in-person activities or events.




A typical day would involve:

Supporting multiple lines of business as a trusted partner to support decision makers with actionable insights leveraged from Vancity’s rich data.
Humanizing insights from data by crafting narratives with analysis and a clear ‘so what’ with measurable recommendations. You’ll support this output by building analytical models, hypothesis validation, evaluating results from test & learn experiments, and handling ad hoc analysis requests.
Resolving complex information needs and translating them into executable research and analytics initiatives.
Supporting the director in compiling and communicating research and analytics insights to enable the delivery of key business strategies and decisions.
Identifying emerging trends, risks and opportunities, assess implications, and make recommendations to management to mitigate potential risks and identify potential opportunities for the business.
Working closely with the Analytics Centre of Excellence and in collaboration with leaders, business stakeholders, consultants, and external agencies/data providers as needed. This role has significant exposure to the VP level.




You have:

Excellent analytical thinking capability, skilled at probing stakeholders to uncover business problems and translating these into analytical questions and summarizing insights to reach conclusion
Excellent communication skills. Strong ability to explain complicated ideas to broader audiences using non-technical language
Strong presentation skills, able to organize information and present analytical results in an efficient manner
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or other quantitative fields
5-7 years of experience in analytics
Thorough working knowledge of relational databases and advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools (must have)
Proficiency with: R/Python, Power BI / Tableau. Working level statistical skills, including regression, time series, champion/challenger testing, and decision tree modeling
Ability to access complex data sources, explore data resources, clean and compile data to provide analytical driven solutions to real business problems
You are familiar with best practices in statistical methodologies and innovative analytical tools, and can leverage this knowledge to support our business stakeholders to make stronger decisions

Bonus points, if you have:

Experience in any of the following domains would be considered an asset: financial services/banking, credit cards/payments, credit risk, marketing campaigns, CRM, call center operations




You are:

Passionate about giving meaning to data
Someone who enjoys investigating complex problems, and making sense of information and thinking conceptually
Comfortable with ambiguity




We value lived experience, so if you are interested in this role, we encourage you to apply even if you feel your skills don't perfectly align with those listed.




The salary range for this role is $81,200 to $122,000 annually. Base pay offered may vary depending on factors such as relevant qualifications, skills, previous experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards package, employees may also be eligible for our annual incentive program, subject to program eligibility requirements.




Posting Deadline: Posted until filled




A career at Vancity is more than just a job, you’re joining a tradition of change-makers who are creating lasting change for our communities. Beyond base pay, we offer a comprehensive total rewards package to ensure our employees are empowered to thrive:




We offer:

We are the largest private-sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada.
Our permanent employees qualify for attractive benefit packages that can be customized and changed each year to meet their evolving needs.
New employees receive between three to four weeks of vacation allowance per calendar year, and the number of vacation days grows
In addition to the 10 statutory holidays in British Columbia, Vancity provides an additional three statutory holidays. We offer care days for periods of short-term personal illness or emergency family illness.
We have flex credits for our health care & dental benefits offer three levels of coverage for you to select from. These benefits will also be effective immediately based on your hire date.
We understand that retirement means different things to different people and at Vancity we will offer you a Defined benefits pension plan that pays you a retirement income for life.




At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience.




We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment experience for all candidates. If you require any accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at recruitment@vancity.com for confidential support. In-person assistance is also available. We will collaborate with you to ensure your needs are met promptly and effectively.

Show more
HTML:
About Vancity

Vancity is a member-owned credit union built on the principles of inclusion and social justice. A relentless commitment to their values has helped them challenge the status quo and break down barriers since day one in 1946. They have bold commitments to make Vancity net-zero by 2040 across all mortgages and loans and are pursuing strategies on Indigenous banking and to improve the financial resilience of their members.


Vancity is the largest private sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and has been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada. If you’re interested in joining their team of 2,700 diverse individuals and accessing competitive rewards and benefits, all while knowing you are part of a greater movement, then apply today!


About the workplace

The Vancity Analytics Centre of Excellence (ACE) is a force for change. Our mandate is simple - we leverage our data with actionable insights that help our leaders make stronger decisions. We use a deeply human approach - telling stories in the language of our stakeholders with a proactive and predictive lens. We don’t rely on complex charts; we focus on the ‘so what’ of every question and insight to deliver value. We work collaboratively with our colleagues to serve our members and our business.


This is a permanent, full-time role that will enjoy hybrid working arrangements which can be fulfilled primarily from the Vancity head office location and your Lower Mainland based home office. Periodically, you’ll be required to attend in-person activities or events.


A typical day would involve:

  • Supporting multiple lines of business as a trusted partner to support decision makers with actionable insights leveraged from Vancity’s rich data.
  • Humanizing insights from data by crafting narratives with analysis and a clear ‘so what’ with measurable recommendations. You’ll support this output by building analytical models, hypothesis validation, evaluating results from test & learn experiments, and handling ad hoc analysis requests.
  • Resolving complex information needs and translating them into executable research and analytics initiatives.
  • Supporting the director in compiling and communicating research and analytics insights to enable the delivery of key business strategies and decisions.
  • Identifying emerging trends, risks and opportunities, assess implications, and make recommendations to management to mitigate potential risks and identify potential opportunities for the business.
  • Working closely with the Analytics Centre of Excellence and in collaboration with leaders, business stakeholders, consultants, and external agencies/data providers as needed. This role has significant exposure to the VP level.


You have:

  • Excellent analytical thinking capability, skilled at probing stakeholders to uncover business problems and translating these into analytical questions and summarizing insights to reach conclusion
  • Excellent communication skills. Strong ability to explain complicated ideas to broader audiences using non-technical language
  • Strong presentation skills, able to organize information and present analytical results in an efficient manner
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or other quantitative fields
  • 5-7 years of experience in analytics
  • Thorough working knowledge of relational databases and advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools (must have)
  • Proficiency with: R/Python, Power BI / Tableau. Working level statistical skills, including regression, time series, champion/challenger testing, and decision tree modeling
  • Ability to access complex data sources, explore data resources, clean and compile data to provide analytical driven solutions to real business problems
  • You are familiar with best practices in statistical methodologies and innovative analytical tools, and can leverage this knowledge to support our business stakeholders to make stronger decisions

Bonus points, if you have:

  • Experience in any of the following domains would be considered an asset: financial services/banking, credit cards/payments, credit risk, marketing campaigns, CRM, call center operations


You are:

  • Passionate about giving meaning to data
  • Someone who enjoys investigating complex problems, and making sense of information and thinking conceptually
  • Comfortable with ambiguity


We value lived experience, so if you are interested in this role, we encourage you to apply even if you feel your skills don't perfectly align with those listed.


The salary range for this role is $81,200 to $122,000 annually. Base pay offered may vary depending on factors such as relevant qualifications, skills, previous experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards package, employees may also be eligible for our annual incentive program, subject to program eligibility requirements.


Posting Deadline: Posted until filled


A career at Vancity is more than just a job, you’re joining a tradition of change-makers who are creating lasting change for our communities. Beyond base pay, we offer a comprehensive total rewards package to ensure our employees are empowered to thrive:


We offer:

  • We are the largest private-sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada.
  • Our permanent employees qualify for attractive benefit packages that can be customized and changed each year to meet their evolving needs.
  • New employees receive between three to four weeks of vacation allowance per calendar year, and the number of vacation days grows
  • In addition to the 10 statutory holidays in British Columbia, Vancity provides an additional three statutory holidays. We offer care days for periods of short-term personal illness or emergency family illness.
  • We have flex credits for our health care & dental benefits offer three levels of coverage for you to select from. These benefits will also be effective immediately based on your hire date.
  • We understand that retirement means different things to different people and at Vancity we will offer you a Defined benefits pension plan that pays you a retirement income for life.


At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience.


We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment experience for all candidates. If you require any accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at recruitment@vancity.com for confidential support. In-person assistance is also available. We will collaborate with you to ensure your needs are met promptly and effectively.

Title: Data Engineer (ID#5079)
Description:
New Value Solutions, a national IT consulting company, is seeking a Data Engineer who will be responsible for enabling and delivering the data platform (e.g., data warehouse) for a project's analytics use. This includes establishing the end-to-end data for the project's analytics pipeline including ingesting data from a variety of data sources (e.g., SNOW, Dynatrace, AzDO) and creating datasets for analytics and reporting purposes.




The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with experience in data architecture and analytic solutions.




Responsibilities:




1. Data Ingestion:

Ingesting relational, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from on premise, cloud, external, document, and other data sources.
Monitoring & developing guidelines for data ingestion streams for the project.




2. Data modelling:

Designing logical data models.
Centralizing business rules and logic for the purpose of efficient, accurate, and consistent analytics solution delivery.
Implementing logic, such as calculations, derivations, table relationships, data cleansing and standardization, data mapping and linking, etc. in a way which minimizes future efforts for changes.
Data modelling and data ingestion experience with one or more of the following products or systems is an asset: ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, Dynatrace.
Blending data from multiple sources into a single information context.




3. Data Quality Assurance:

Ensure data meets entity an attribute quality requirement.
Ensure data lineage; ensure standardization for common format data elements.




Requirements:




Familiar with reporting and analytics tools.
Advanced SQL skills including stored procedures and data transformation.
Advanced API integration skills (for data ingestion).
Expertise in Power Query (M) for data cleansing, transformation, and building reusable dataflows.
Experience designing optimized data models and star schemas for high-performance reporting.
Ability to implement row-level security and manage workspace permissions in Power BI Service.
Skilled in developing interactive dashboards & visualizations tailored to executive and operational needs.
Advanced DAX skills to create complex measures, calculated tables, and dynamic KPIs.
Familiarity with performance tuning techniques (aggregations, incremental refresh, query folding).




If you have this expertise, and are able to work in Canada, please submit your resume. While we thank all candidates in advance for their application, only those candidates who are shortlisted will be contacted.




ID# 5079




The hourly rate range for this position is $70 - $95, with the final rate based on consultant experience and fit for the role.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
The Business Systems Analyst supports the creation of integrated workflows between business critical systems across the enterprise. This role builds automation systems that allow integration between business systems (ERP, CRM, HRIS, ect) and production systems; reducing the need for manual processes within the business.

Podtech Data Centers Inc., the employing entity, is a proud member of the IREN Group and we are currently looking to hire!

IREN is a leading next-generation data center business powering the future with 100% renewable energy. We build, own and operate our data centers and take pride in being at the forefront of sustainable solutions for the ever-evolving applications of high-performance compute. We believe that human progress is invaluable, but it should be done in the right way – responsibly, sustainably and having a positive impact on the communities we operate in.

We have grown substantially since 2019, from our inception in Australia to now having several facilities across North America and being listed on NASDAQ… and we are just getting started! By joining us, you will be contributing to the future of sustainable high-performance compute and the local communities we strive to have a positive impact on.

We value diverse perspectives and believe that skills can be developed. If you’re passionate about this role, we want to hear from you — whether you meet every criteria or not. Your unique experiences might be exactly what we need!

Apply today to be considered for an exciting opportunity with us.

The Business Systems Analyst has a broad remit within our team, supporting the creation of integrated workflows between business critical systems across the enterprise. This role is a critical to the support and enablement of our continued growth by ensuring that teams are enabled to use best in class tools in a seamlessly integrated environment.

By building reusable orchestration systems, your work will build the foundation of how our production and business systems operate together as we continue to grow. You will gain experience with a broad range of systems, from virtual to physical, where bringing your knowledge and drive to enable others to shape how we work at IREN.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the IT Senior Manager, the Business Systems Analyst will:


Be responsible for managing system integrations, data flows, and custom development efforts to ensure interaction between different business applications (e.g., ERP, CRM, HRIS) and other internal systems.
Lead the development of custom solutions, integrations, automations, and enhancements within IT enterprise systems based on business needs
Develop custom applications, scripts, and automations to meet specific business needs that cannot be addressed by out-of-the-box solutions
Ensure data consistency and integrity across all systems by managing data flows, handling data transformations, and applying governance rules
Maintain and manage APIs and middleware solutions to connect systems, reduce manual work, and streamline business processes
Ensure that all integrations and custom developments adhere to the organization's security protocols
Use a ticketing system for tracking issues, troubleshooting, user support and internal communications
Act as the primary point of contact for resolving system integration issues, providing technical support, and maintaining system uptime
Work with a dynamic team where roles are fluid, but goals are unified. Expect to learn skills beyond the role, and continuously improve your craft
Work closely with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver efficiencies between systems.


Desired Qualifications Include


Expertise in system integration technologies (N8N, Workato, Zapier, Boomi, etc.) and/or orchestration (Temporal, Airflow, etc.).
Strong programming skills for developing solutions (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc); Experience integrating with the Microsoft 365 suite and Entra ID a strong asset.
Experience with ERP (NetSuite, Oracle, SAP), HRIS (HiBOB, Workday, etc.), CRM (Hubspot, Salesforce, etc) or other enterprise software platforms a strong asset.
Familiarity with data architecture, data governance, and security best practices.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent combination of education/experience.


The IREN Package


Salary range: Starting at CAD $100,000/annum, depending on experience
Short-term and Long-term Incentive Programs
Extended Health and Dental Benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Casual work attire


Podtech Data Centers Inc., the employing entity and proud member of the IREN Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates under consideration.

By applying for this position and submitting your resume and application materials, you consent to the processing of your personal information in accordance with our Job Applicant Privacy Statement available on our website at www.iren.com.

Title: Co-op/Intern, Data Engineering - Fall 2025
Description:
Title: Co-op/Intern, Data Engineering - Fall 2025

Location: Toronto, ON or Vancouver, BC

Term: 4 months

Start Date: September 8, 2025

Openings: 1

We’re looking for a self-driven individual seeking a co-op opportunity with a high-profile tech company. We believe that talent and valuable skills come from many paths. That's why this role is open to individuals from diverse backgrounds, including those looking to change careers with transferable skills, immigrants eager for local work experience, and people rejoining the workforce after a leave (such as parental, retirement, or a career transition), as well as students pursuing traditional co-op work terms.

Overview

Our Data Analysis & Visualization team seeks motivated and proactive co-op students to join us for the Fall 2025 term. The successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, learning and contributing to various Finance functions while developing their skills.

Responsibilities by Team (could include but are not limited to):

In this role, you will be integral to the development and maintenance of our data infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to work with large datasets and contribute to the foundation of our data-driven insights.


Design, construct, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to support our analytics and business intelligence teams.
Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide robust, efficient data solutions.
Contribute to the enhancement of our data architecture, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accessibility across the organization.
Develop documentation for data models, data flows, and system processes to support knowledge sharing and team collaboration.


Requirements


Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program, preferably in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
Proficiency in a programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Solid understanding of SQL and experience with relational or non-relational databases.
Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT concepts.
Strong problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
A demonstrated passion for data engineering and an eagerness to learn new technologies.


Benefits


Gain hands-on experience in Data Analysis & Visualizations Operations.
Develop and enhance data-driven knowledge and skills.
Opportunity to work with a dynamic and collaborative team.
Potential for future employment opportunities upon completion of the co-op term.


We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration.

Who You Are


Solution seeker: You’re focused on tackling new challenges, solving problems, and moving the business forward—and you don’t wait to be asked.
Lifelong learner: You have a growth mindset – you’re here to learn, experiment, seek, apply, and provide feedback, share what works with your team, and move on from what doesn’t.
Resilient adapter: In the face of change and challenges, you bring a thoughtful, calm approach and a focus on finding new opportunities.
Intentional collaborator. You build positive working relationships across the business, bringing people together to foster new opportunities and to facilitate the efficient flow of information.
Critical challenger: You have the trust in your team to ask difficult questions in order to get to the best end result.
Active communicator: You listen actively and communicate ideas and information clearly, inclusively, and proactively.
Integrated thinker: You look beyond your role and responsibilities to understand how your team’s work drives broader organizational goals.
Accountable owner: You take pride in the work you’re responsible for with a mindset of ultimate accountability and reliability for the outcomes.
Bar-raiser: You step up to help your team grow and succeed, even when that means going beyond what might be expected.


In all we do, our six guiding principles light the way:

Step Up: Show the world what it looks like to live and work by these guiding principles. #StepUp

One Team: Make Hootsuite a place where everyone feels safe, welcome, valued, and empowered to do their best work without compromising who they are. #OneTeam #FreeToBeMe

Customer Obsessed: Focus relentlessly on helping our customers succeed. #CustomerObsessed

Go Fast, Be Agile: Widen our competitive advantage by committing to speed and simplicity over perfection and complexity. #GoFastBeAgile

Play to Win: Commit to building an incredible, profitable company for our customers, our employees, and our stakeholders. #PlayToWin #NoExcuses

Neighbours & Allies: Give back to our communities and be an ally. #SocialForGood #Allies

Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Canada Pay Range For This Role
$46,100—$55,400 CAD

Show more

  • Intentional collaborator. You build positive working relationships across the business, bringing people together to foster new opportunities and to facilitate the efficient flow of information.
  • Critical challenger: You have the trust in your team to ask difficult questions in order to get to the best end result.
  • Active communicator: You listen actively and communicate ideas and information clearly, inclusively, and proactively.
  • Integrated thinker: You look beyond your role and responsibilities to understand how your team’s work drives broader organizational goals.
  • Accountable owner: You take pride in the work you’re responsible for with a mindset of ultimate accountability and reliability for the outcomes.
  • Bar-raiser: You step up to help your team grow and succeed, even when that means going beyond what might be expected.

In all we do, our six guiding principles light the way:

Step Up: Show the world what it looks like to live and work by these guiding principles. #StepUp

One Team: Make Hootsuite a place where everyone feels safe, welcome, valued, and empowered to do their best work without compromising who they are. #OneTeam #FreeToBeMe

Customer Obsessed: Focus relentlessly on helping our customers succeed. #CustomerObsessed

Go Fast, Be Agile: Widen our competitive advantage by committing to speed and simplicity over perfection and complexity. #GoFastBeAgile

Play to Win: Commit to building an incredible, profitable company for our customers, our employees, and our stakeholders. #PlayToWin #NoExcuses

Neighbours & Allies: Give back to our communities and be an ally. #SocialForGood #Allies

Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Canada Pay Range For This Role
$46,100—$55,400 CAD

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading automotive parts retailer, is seeking a Business System Analyst to join their team in a full-time, permanent position. This role will be in-office five days a week at their Port Coquitlam head office. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.




This role focuses on identifying, planning, developing, and implementing technical changes, acting as an ambassador for digital transformation. The Business System Analyst plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between supply chain and retail operations teams and their technology systems that help drive their business. Responsibilities include collaborating with multiple business functions and IT teams to develop and implement solutions that improve operational efficiency, integrating and supporting best-in-class enterprise-wide applications, and helping lead the planning and coordination of enhancements for various software applications. The role also involves analyzing data, identifying opportunities for process improvement, and collaborating on implementing solutions that enhance retail operations. They will conduct thorough business process analysis, develop and maintain dashboards and reports, and conduct systems analysis and design activities. Providing actionable insights and recommendations to drive retail strategies and company success is also a key part of the role, including evaluating and recommending IT systems, tools, and software and preparing plans and delivery dates for work packages.




Qualifications:

A diploma/degree in both computer science and business studies.
5+ years of professional development experience within an enterprise environment.
Strong communication skills that enable IT to collaborate with business partners on new initiatives.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and data visualization software like PowerBI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Experience in a large-scale retail IT environment.
Extensive knowledge and experience of IT systems, relational databases, and data analysis.
The ability to excel at identifying and understanding business problems with a proven track record of translating those problems into requirements for working solutions.
A demonstrated history of success in problem-solving complex issues with a strong attention to detail.
A background in making critical and successful decisions under pressure.
Knowledge of the retail industry.
